hero.label: Careers
hero.title: Build Something That Matters
hero.description: Join a team that's transforming how organizations operate. We're looking for people who want to make a real impact—not just collect a paycheck.

intro.title: We're Not Your Typical Consulting Firm
intro.description: At LeanGo, we believe the best consultants don't just advise—they roll up their sleeves and work alongside clients. We're a small, focused team that values depth over breadth, quality over quantity, and lasting results over quick wins.
highlights: Direct client impact on every project
Work with people who genuinely want to improve
Your ideas matter—regardless of your title

items.title: Meaningful Work
items.description: Every project makes a real difference. You'll see the direct impact of your work in improved operations, empowered teams, and measurable results.

items.title: Continuous Learning
items.description: We invest heavily in your development. Training, certifications, conferences, and dedicated learning time are all part of the package.

items.title: True Flexibility
items.description: We trust you to manage your time. Remote work, flexible hours, and a focus on outcomes over face time. Your life, your schedule.

items.title: Great People
items.description: Work alongside smart, humble people who genuinely want to help each other succeed. No egos, no politics, just good work.

benefits.label: Benefits & Perks
benefits.title: We Take Care of Our Team

perks: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
Wellness stipend for gym, apps, or equipment

items.title: Senior Lean Consultant
items.description: Lead improvement engagements with manufacturing and construction clients. You'll work directly with leadership teams to identify opportunities, facilitate workshops, and coach teams through transformation.
requirements: 5+ years of hands-on lean/continuous improvement experience
Experience leading kaizen events and value stream mapping
Manufacturing or construction industry background preferred
Lean Six Sigma certification (Green Belt minimum)
responsibilities: Lead client assessments and develop improvement roadmaps
Facilitate workshops, training sessions, and kaizen events
Coach client teams on lean principles and problem-solving
Build lasting relationships with client stakeholders
Contribute to LeanGo's methodology and training materials

items.title: Full-Stack Developer
items.description: Build custom applications that solve real operational problems. You'll work closely with consultants and clients to understand needs, then design and build solutions that make a tangible difference.
requirements: Strong SQL skills and database design experience
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Ability to translate business problems into technical solutions
responsibilities: Design and build custom web applications for clients
Create intuitive interfaces that non-technical users love
Integrate with existing client systems and data sources
Maintain and improve internal tools and platforms
Collaborate with consultants to understand client needs

items.title: Data Analyst
items.description: Transform client data into actionable insights. You'll design dashboards, build reports, and help organizations see their operations in a whole new way.
requirements: Experience with visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar)
Basic scripting skills (Python or R preferred)
responsibilities: Analyze client data to identify trends and opportunities
Design and build interactive dashboards and reports
Work with clients to understand their metrics and KPIs
Document data sources, transformations, and calculations
Train client teams on using analytics tools

process.label: Hiring Process
process.title: What to Expect
process.description: We keep things simple and respectful of your time. Here's how it works:

steps.title: Apply
steps.description: Send us your resume and a brief note about why you're interested. No cover letter required—just tell us what excites you.

steps.title: Initial Chat
steps.description: A 30-minute call with someone from our team to learn about each other. Casual conversation, no trick questions.

steps.title: Skills Discussion
steps.description: A deeper conversation about your experience and approach. We might look at a past project or work through a scenario together.

steps.title: Team Meet
steps.description: Meet a few team members you'd work with. This is as much for you to evaluate us as it is for us to evaluate you.

steps.title: Decision
steps.description: We move fast. You'll hear back within a few days with a clear answer and feedback either way.

culture.label: Our Culture
culture.title: How We Work Together
culture.description: We're a small team that punches above our weight. Here's what that looks like day-to-day:

points.title: Outcome-Focused
points.description: We care about results, not hours logged. Get your work done well, and how you structure your day is up to you.

points.title: Radically Honest
points.description: We give direct feedback because we care about each other's growth. No passive-aggression, no politics.

points.title: Continuously Improving
points.description: We practice what we preach. Regular retrospectives, experiments, and a genuine commitment to getting better.

points.title: Supportive
points.description: We celebrate wins, learn from failures together, and always have each other's backs. No blame games.

items.title: Impact Over Activity
items.description: We'd rather do one thing that matters than ten things that don't. Every effort should move the needle.

items.title: Teach, Don't Tell
items.description: Our goal is to make clients self-sufficient, not dependent on us. We share knowledge freely.

items.title: Simplicity Wins
items.description: The best solutions are usually the simplest. We resist the urge to overcomplicate.

items.title: Respect Everyone
items.description: Frontline workers often have the best insights. We listen to everyone, regardless of title.

cta.title: Don't See the Right Role?
cta.description: We're always interested in talented people who share our values. Send us your resume and tell us what you'd bring to the team—we'll keep you in mind for future opportunities.
